<< assert_isapprox assertion functions

assert

Check that condition is true.

Syntax

assert(x)
r = assert(x)
[r, msg] = assert(x)
assert(x, err_msg)
r = assert(x, err_msg)
[r, msg] = assert(x, err_msg)

Input argument

x

a logical value

err_msg

a string, the error message to be printed in case of failure (optional).

Output argument

res

a logical value

msg

a string value, the error message. If x == true, then msg == ''. If x == false, then msg contains the error message.

Description

Raises an error if x is false. Raises an error if x is not a logical.

Example

assert(4 == 3, _('error for comparaison.'))

See also

assert_istrue, assert_isfalse.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET

<< assert_isapprox assertion functions
